summary: Kenneth D. Klein was an employee of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents indicate that he was a staff member whose payroll records are documented. The records include salary adjustments and termination details, suggesting his employment spanned a period during the HSCA's investigation. While the documents directly related to Klein focus on his employment and payroll, the broader context of the HSCA suggests he was involved in the investigation into the assassination of President John F. Kennedy.
significance: Kenneth D. Klein's significance lies in his role as a staff member of the HSCA, which was tasked with investigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. His payroll records provide insight into the operational aspects of the HSCA and the individuals involved in the investigation, though his specific contributions to the investigation are not detailed in these documents.
